alert.note: Alert for Northern Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 1:49PM MST until January 07 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Extended period of bitter cold, periods of snow with blowing snow and dangerous wind chills. * WHERE...Northern Carbon. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The major change will occur Tuesday during the day with light snow falling as temperatures fall 20 degrees or more during the day. Wednesday will be the coldest day/night with low temperatures 15 -to 30 -with 30 -to 40 - wind chills. Thursday looks to be the best day for significant snowfall.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1. Additional graphics for this hazard can be found at http://www.weather.gov/billings
